children.value: Create an HTTP Response Header Modification Rule in the dashboard
Create HTTP Response Header Modification Rules in the
, and select your account and website.

children.alt: Create HTTP Response Header Modification rule page

children.value: Enter a descriptive name for the HTTP Response Header Modification Rule in
, select one of the following options:
— Sets the value of an HTTP response header to a static string value. Overrides the value of an existing header with the same name or adds a new header if it does not exist.
— Sets the value of an HTTP response header according to the provided expression. Overrides the value of an existing header with the same name or adds a new header if it does not exist.
— Removes the HTTP response header with the provided name, if it exists.
Enter the name of the HTTP response header to modify in
and the static value or expression in
, if you are setting the header value.
To modify another HTTP response header in the same rule, click
The following example includes the modification of three response headers using the available actions:
You can modify up to 30 HTTP response headers in a single rule.
To save and deploy your rule, click
. If you are not ready to deploy your rule, click
After creating a rule, you return to the
If you choose to deploy your HTTP Response Header Modification Rule, the new rule will be enabled. If you save the rule as a draft, the new rule will be disabled.
